--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "J. B. Rainsberger" <jbrains@r...> wrote:
> I like keeping test classes separate from production classes, so
that I don't have to rely on a naming convention.

Yeah, me too.  Eclipse has encouraged me to do this.
 
> You might try GSBase's RecursiveTestSuite which allows you to scan
the file system for tests, then use a TestFilter to choose the ones
you want to execute. This is not an Ant-based solution.

Thanks, J.B.  I'll have to think about whether or not it's worth
hooking this into the ant build.  In the mean time, I've set it up
using a naming convention ("**/*Test.class") in my test class tree,
but that raises the possibility of missing a test due to a naming error.

 - George
